column4: dose anyone know a good way to convert mp3 to ogg in ubuntu dapper
mp32ogg
!kernel | johnficca
does it happen if you open a new terminal?
from your menu
I've seen that problem before, there is a thread on the forums about it.  But I don't remember seeing a definitive answer
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=161814

I do know that if i have an old screen session lying around, I get that same behavior and I believe it is because the DBUS env variables are old and no longer point to the correct DBUS session for my user (I logout and log back in while keeping screen running)
try gksudo and gksu and see if there is a difference
what is "it"?  both gksu and gksudo?
how comfortable are you messing with files on your system??
I'm ok with it
in /root, get rid of most of the config stuff (just rename .foo to .foo.backup), especially .gnome2 and .gconf
rename all of the folder in there
try just .gnome2 and .gconf
try gksudo gedit again
hey I think it works now
is that it ?
ubuntu remade .gconf and .gnome2 is that ok
ok now the problem is back
hmm does it go away again if you delete those files again?
